title: Hardware
description: This are the physical devices I use for work and / or entertainment on the daily.

children.title: Windows 10 custom computer
children.description: My main personal computer. It has an Intel Core i7-10700 with 16GB RAM and 1TB + 500GB storage.

children.title: 14" 2023 MacBook M2 Pro
children.description: The computer provided by my current employers; I use it only while on the job.

children.title: Android 12 phone
children.description: My personal phone I use mostly to browse the web, take calls and be available while away from my computer.

title: Software
description: I'm currently using a Windows 10 machine and the software I use is installed on that operating system, so availability may vary.

children.title: Firefox
children.description: This is my current browser of choice. I have it customised with some extensions you can check out further in this page.

children.title: Godot
children.description: Godot is my current favourite game engine. After having tried RPG Maker and Game Maker Studio, I've been tinkering with Godot for a while and enjoyed it greatly.

children.title: VSCodium
children.description: A fork of VSCode, VSCodium is everything I would want in a code editor. I've used VSCode since I started coding professionally, and I've never thought of using anything else.

children.title: GIMP
children.description: I don't have a lot of experience with GIMP. I grew up using a cracked version of Photoshop for everything I needed, but I've been wanting to use more of GIMP instead of supporting Adobe.

children.title: Inkscape
children.description: Like with GIMP, Inkscape is an alternative to Adobe (in this case, Illustrator) that I've been trying to familiarize myself with.

children.title: Krita
children.description: I've tried a few illustration programs in my life -Photoshop, Paint Tool Sai, Clip Studio Paint -and now I've been practicing and loving Krita.

children.title: Blender
children.description: Blender is a standard for a reason. I first tried to learn 3D with Blender when I was a teen, and now I've been tinkering with it again for a few years and still want to learn more.

children.title: Libresprite
children.description: An open source alternative to Asesprite, Libresprite is everything I need whenever I am making any kind of pixel art for my games.

children.title: LibreOffice
children.description: I've been using LibreOffice for years, ever since I pivoted away from Microsoft Word, and I've never looked back.

children.title: OBS
children.description: OBS is a standard in the video capturing scene and is what I use any time I need to make a small showcase of my games.

title: Websites and web-apps
description: These are some websites and webservices I find of particular interest.

children.title: DuckDuckGo
children.description: With the enshittification of Google, I've been using DuckDuckGo as my main browser for a while and it fills almost any need I have.

children.title: @32bit.cafe RSS
children.description: I had wanted a RSS reader for years but only when I discovered this one I started to use it daily.

children.title: Internet archive
children.description: If you like libraries, the Internet Archive is a dream come true. I've found more obscure media here than in any other place in the Internet.

children.title: Wayback machine
children.description: I'm a nostalgic person, and whenever I want to remind myself of how the Internet used to be I go to the Wayback Machine.

children.title: Web design museum
children.description: I like websites, and I prefer old-school and Y2K design trends so I find myself browsing the Web design museum for inspritation.

children.title: Neocities
children.description: I've hosted my blog in Vercel, Netlify and other services and now I like to keep it simple and use Neocities.

title: Web add-ons and extensions
description: These are plugins I have installed on my preferred browser all the time

children.title: uBlock origin
children.description: Navigating the web today is impossible with an add blocker, and uBlock origin is recommended for a reason.

children.title: bitwarden
children.description: If you want to secure your accounts, you have to use complex passwords and other key systems, and Bitwarden is a very complete and ease to use vault and password manager.

children.title: Tree Style Tab
children.description: I tend to have lots of tabs open, and I prefer the vertical layout of Tree Style Tab over the standard horizontal one.

children.title: A fine start
children.description: I never knew I wanted the ability to completely customize the links in my browser's home page until I got recommended A fine start.
